dialogue: What? I'm not your...wait. Am I your Mom? No. No, that doesn’t make sense. We’re the same age. I’m not a woman. Am I? I’ve always been so confident in my masculinity, but now...
Well to begin with, you've got me questioning my entire gender identity. Is gender even real? Are we all, in a sense, each other’s mothers? Am I a woman? Did I metaphorically give birth to you?

Wow. I'd thought this was a beautiful moment of connection, a transformation of our best buddyhood into more of a nurturing, maternal relationship. But now it’s awful? Or...is that just another part of the metaphor?
Well, I appreciate you letting me know. Please, keep me posted.
Thanks, man. That means a lot to me. I'm going to keep exploring these new feelings that you’ve awoken; I’ll make sure to let you know if...-
Okay, he's gone. My boss was hovering, and - as I believe I’ve mentioned - we’re not meant to take personal calls at work unless it’s an emergency.
No, Quinn. You're not my mother. We’re the same age.
Well, yeah, I know that, but I thought...maybe metaphorically...
Do you want to be my mother, or my best friend?
I thought I knew the answer to that, but now...now I'm not so sure.
-sigh- Okay, Quinn. You think on that and let me know where you land.
Thanks! I'll call you back when I’ve got a better idea.
I hang up. That's what I love about Steve; he always gets me to think about the big issues in life. He’s definitely my favorite son.
